title.narrative: Strengthening and raising awareness of local campesinos/as' collective environmental rights in Nuñoa

description.narrative:
This project is the Peru third party grant component of a EU regional HRD project that aims to support and protect human right defenders at risk working on land and environmental rights in Latin America.
This project will work with the central district organisation of the 'rondas campesinas' of Nuñoa (CEDROCAN), in the province of Melgar (Puno region), where local communities have rejected extractives operations and proposed projects. Lack of prior consultation and environmental contamination has generated socio-environmental conflicts, in a rural area that lives from agriculture and cattle grazing. The campesino 'rondas' are important actors in defending the rights of indigenous campesino communities, their territory and the environment. By supporting CEDROCAN with organisational strengthening, they will have a greater awareness of their rights, so that they can better defend themselves against criminalisation and strengthen their demands that their collective rights and the protection of the environment are observed. In addition to working directly with these 'rondas campesinas' to help them develop their community statutes, different communication channels will be used to raise awareness among a wider public and to strengthen the voice of the actors themselves not only at local level, but also at regional and national level. The activities will include strengthening workshops with CEDROCAN; a public forum; the dissemination of this information through two educational audios and a brochure, drawing up an anthropological study and radio programmes with local and regional coverage, and a campaign on social networks.
